i can do no good becaus woman reach constantli someth that is near it _the maid s tragedi _ beaumont fletcher miss brook had that kind beauti which seem be thrown relief poor dress her hand wrist were so fine form that she could wear sleev not less bare style than those which bless virgin appear italian painter her profil as well as her statur bear seem gain more digniti her plain garment which side provinci fashion gave her impress fine quotat bibl or one our elder poet paragraph day s newspap she wa usual spoken as be remark clever but addit that her sister celia had more common sens solitud will be more difficult temporari illumin hope ani case i shall remain your sincer devot edward casaubon dorothea trembl while she read thi letter then she fell her knee buri her face sob she railway were as excit topic as reform bill or immin horror cholera those who held most decid view subject were women landhold women both old young regard travel steam as presumptu danger argu against it say that noth should induc them get railway carriag while proprietor differ each other their argument as much as mr solomon featherston differ lord medlicot were yet unanim opinion that sell land enemi mankind or compani oblig purchas these pernici agenc must be made pay veri high price landown permiss injur mankind but slower wit such as mr solomon mr waul who both occupi land their own took long time arriv thi conclus their mind halt vivid concept what it would be cut big pastur two turn it three corner bit which would be nohow while accommod bridg high payment were remot incred cow will all cast their calv brother said mr waul tone deep melancholi if railway come across near close i shouldn t wonder mare too if she wa foal it s poor tale if widow s properti is be spade away law say noth it what s hinder em cut right left if they begin it s well known _i_ can t fight best way would be say noth set somebodi send em away flea their ear when they came spi measur said solomon folk hi voic cautiou manner more spoke we put their wheel more they ll pay us let em go if they must come or not thi reason mr solomon s wa perhap less thorough than he imagin hi cun bear same relat cours railway as cun diplomatist bear gener chill or catarrh solar system but he set act hi view thoroughli diplomat manner stimul suspicion hi side lowick wa most remot villag hous labor peopl were either lone cottag or were collect hamlet call frick where water mill some stone pit made littl centr slow heavi shoulder industri absenc ani precis idea as what railway were public opinion frick wa against them human mind that grassi corner had not proverbi tendenc admir unknown hold rather that it wa like be against poor man that suspicion wa onli wise attitud regard it even rumor reform had not yet excit ani millenni expect frick there be no definit promis it as gratuit grain fatten hiram ford s pig or publican weight scale who would brew beer noth or offer part three neighbor farmer rais wage winter distinct good thi kind it promis reform seem foot brag pedler which wa hint distrust everi know person men frick were not ill fed were less given fanatic than strong muscular suspicion less inclin believ that they were peculiarli care heaven than regard heaven itself as rather dispos take them disposit observ weather thu mind frick wa exactli sort mr solomon featherston work he have more plenteou idea same order suspicion heaven earth which wa better fed more entir leisur solomon wa overs road that time hi slow pace cob often took hi round frick look workmen get stone there paus he had come middlemarch everyth that bad happen him there seem mere prepar thi hate fatal which had come as blight hi honor ambit must make even peopl who had onli vulgar standard regard hi reput as irrevoc damag such moment man can hardli escap be unlov lydgat thought himself as suffer other as agent who had injur hi lot he had meant everyth turn differ other had thrust themselv hi life thwart hi purpos hi marriag seem unmitig calam he wa afraid go rosamond he had vent himself thi solitari rage lest mere sight her should exasper him make him behav unwarrant there are episod most men s live which their highest qualiti can onli cast deter shadow object that fill their inward vision lydgat s tenderhearted wa present just then onli as dread lest he should offend against it not as emot that sway him tender he wa veri miser onli those who know supremaci intellectu life life which ha seed ennobl thought purpos it can understand grief one who fall that seren activ absorb soul wast struggl worldli annoy how wa he live vindic himself peopl who suspect him base how could he go silent away middlemarch as if he were retreat just condemn yet how wa he set vindic himself that scene meet which he had just wit although it had told him no particular had been enough make hi own situat thoroughli clear him bulstrod had been dread scandal disclosur part raffl lydgat could now construct all probabl case he wa afraid some betray my hear all he want wa bind me him strong oblig that wa whi he pass sudden hard liber he may have tamper patient he may have disobey my order i fear he did but he did or not world believ that he somehow or other poison man that i wink crime if i didn t help it yet yet he may not be guilti last offenc it is just possibl that chang me may have been genuin relent effect second thought such as he alleg what we call just possibl is sometim true thing we find it easier believ is grossli fals hi last deal thi man bulstrod may have kept hi hand pure spite my suspicion contrari there wa benumb cruelti hi posit even if he renounc everi other consider than that justifi himself if he met shrug cold glanc avoid as accus made public statement all fact as he knew them who would be convinc it would be play part fool offer hi own testimoni behalf himself say i did not take money as bribe circumst would alway be stronger than hi assert besid come forward tell everyth himself must includ declar bulstrod which would darken suspicion other against him he must tell that he had not known raffl s exist when he first mention hi press need money bulstrod that he took money innoc as result that commun not know that new motiv loan might have arisen hi be call thi man all suspicion bulstrod s motiv might be unjust but then came question he should have act precis same way if he had not taken money certainli if raffl had continu aliv suscept further treatment when he arriv he had then imagin ani disobedi hi order part bulstrod he would have made strict inquiri if hi conjectur had been verifi he would have thrown case spite hi recent heavi oblig but if he had not receiv ani money if bulstrod had never revok hi cold recommend bankruptci would he same forc or signific him that wa uneasi corner lydgat s conscious while he wa review fact resist all reproach if he had been independ thi matter patient s treatment distinct rule that he must do or see done that which he believ best life commit him would have been point which he would have been sturdiest as it wa he had rest consider that disobedi hi order howev it might have arisen could not be consid crime that domin opinion obedi hi order wa just as like be fatal that affair wa simpli one etiquett wherea again again hi time freedom he had denounc pervers patholog doubt moral doubt had said purest experi treatment may still be conscienti my busi is take care life do best i can think it scienc is properli more scrupul than dogma dogma give charter mistak but veri breath scienc is contest mistak must keep conscienc aliv ala scientif conscienc had got debas compani money oblig selfish respect is there medic man them all middlemarch who would question himself as i do said poor lydgat chapter lxxxv then went juri whose name were mr blindman mr no good mr malic mr love lust mr live loos mr headi mr high mind mr enmiti mr liar mr cruelti mr hate light mr implac who everi one gave hi privat verdict against him themselv afterward unanim conclud bring him guilti judg first themselv mr blindman foreman said i see clearli that thi man is heret then said mr no good away such fellow earth ay said mr malic i hate veri look him then said mr love lust i could never endur him nor i said mr live loos he would be alway condemn my way hang him hang him said mr headi sorri scrub said mr high mind my heart riseth against him said mr enmiti he is rogu said mr liar hang is too good him said mr cruelti let us despatch him way said mr hate light then said mr implac might i have all world given me i could not be reconcil him therefor let us forthwith bring him guilti death _pilgrim s progress_ when immort bunyan make hi pictur persecut passion bring their verdict guilti who piti faith that is rare bless lot which some greatest men have not attain know ourselv guiltless condemn crowd be sure that what we are denounc is sole good us pitiabl lot is that man who could not call himself martyr even though he were persuad himself that men who stone him were but ugli passion incarn who know that he is stone not profess right but not be man he profess be thi wa conscious that bulstrod wa wither while he made hi prepar depart middlemarch go end hi stricken life that sad refug indiffer new face duteou merci constanc hi wife had deliv him one dread but it could not hinder her presenc be still tribun which he shrank confess desir advocaci hi equivoc himself death raffl had sustain concept omnisci whom he pray yet he had terror him which would not let him expos them judgment full could not bear he felt shroud her doubt he got strength face her sens that she could not yet feel warrant pronounc that worst condemn him some time perhap when he wa die he would tell her all deep shadow that time when she held hi hand gather dark she might listen recoil hi touch perhap but conceal had been habit hi life impuls confess had no power against dread deeper humili he wa full timid care hi wife not onli becaus he deprec ani harsh judgment her but becaus he felt deep distress sight her suffer she had sent her daughter away board school coast that thi crisi might be hidden them as far as possibl set free their absenc intoler necess account her grief or behold their frighten wonder she could live unconstrainedli sorrow that wa everi day streak her hair white make her eyelid languid tell me anyth that you would like have me do harriet bulstrod had said her i mean regard arrang properti it is my intent not sell land i possess thi neighborhood but leav it you as safe provis if you have ani wish such subject do not conceal it me few day afterward when she had return visit her brother s she began speak her husband subject which had some time been her mind i _should_ like do someth my brother s famili nichola i think we are bound make some amend rosamond her husband walter say mr lydgat must leav town hi practic is almost good noth they have veri littl left settl anywher i would rather do someth ourselv make some amend my poor brother s famili mr bulstrod did not wish go nearer fact than phrase make some amend know that her husband must understand her he had particular reason which she wa not awar winc her suggest he hesit he said it is not possibl carri your wish way you propos my dear mr lydgat ha virtual reject ani further servic me he ha return thousand pound which i lent him mr casaubon advanc him sum that purpos here is hi letter letter seem cut mr bulstrod sever mention mr casaubon s loan seem reflect that public feel which held it matter month had been bright bloom it had age keep sad compani hi own wither featur urg some effort comfort her he said there is anoth mean harriet which i might do servic your brother s famili if you like
